Pre-Game Insights: India faces Pakistan at the ICC Men’s 2021 Cricket World T20 tournament on October 24, 2021.
This is the first Group 2 encounter of the crucial Super 12 match and the first match of the tournament for both India and Pakistan.
India goes into this match with a 5-0 advantage over Pakistan in Cricket World T20 competitions.
Babar Azam and Virat Kohli will be captaining their sides for the first time in a T20I match involving India and Pakistan.
Babar Azam has a winning percentage of 65.21% in T20 matches, slightly higher than Virat Kohli's 65.11%.
Virat Kohli has a better batting average (52.65) compared to Babar Azam (46.89).
Matthew Hayden, Pakistan Batting Consultant, emphasized the importance of Babar Azam's role as a captain and batsman.
Virat Kohli expressed confidence ahead of the match through a Twitter post.
Hasan Ali and Jasprit Bumrah will be key players in the pace department for their respective sides.
Hasan Ali has a better batting average (17.00) compared to Jasprit Bumrah (4.00).
Imad Wasim and Ravindra Jadeja are effective utility all-rounders for their respective teams.
Imad Wasim has a better bowling average (23.09) compared to Ravindra Jadeja (29.53).
Ravindra Jadeja has a better batting average (15.50) compared to Imad Wasim (13.12).
The match is expected to have a large global viewership and many spectators in the stadium.
India is considered the favorite going into the game, while Pakistan aims to break their World T20 shackles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium, Dubai, United Arab Emirates (UAE).
The game is expected to be tense and exciting, with expert analysis provided by studio guests and commentators.
